intro: Hieracium doronicifolium subsp. perfixum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
